meanings.definition: Directing or guiding something through a specific channel or pathway.
meanings.sent1: She was channelizing the water into the garden hose.
meanings.sent2: The traffic cones were channelizing the cars into the correct lane.
meanings.sent3: The ducks were channelizing themselves into a neat line behind their leader.
meanings.sent4: His words were channelizing her thoughts towards a solution.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was channelizing the students' energy into a productive discussion.

meanings.definition: Diverting or controlling the flow of something through a channel.
meanings.sent1: The channelizing of the river prevented flooding in the town.
meanings.sent2: The channelizing of funds towards education improved the schools.
meanings.sent3: The channelizing of the conversation towards politics made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The channelizing of resources into research led to groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The channelizing of traffic through the construction zone kept everyone safe.

meanings.definition: Making something more structured or organized by using channels.
meanings.sent1: She was channelizing her tasks by creating a to-do list.
meanings.sent2: Channelizing the information flow improved communication within the team.
meanings.sent3: The chef was channelizing the ingredients to prepare the dish efficiently.
meanings.sent4: Channelizing the cables reduced clutter and improved safety in the office.
meanings.sent5: The manager was channelizing the workflow to increase productivity.
